00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to Octeon boot structure
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision:  $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __OCTEON_BOOT_INFO_H__
00049 #define __OCTEON_BOOT_INFO_H__
00050 
00051 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00052 #include <linux/types.h>
00053 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-asm.h>
00054 #elif defined(__U_BOOT__)
00055 # include <asm/arch/cvmx-asm.h>
00056 #else
00057 # include "cvmx-asm.h"
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 /* Currently only used by u-boot.  Applications use the value in
00061  * cvmx-boot-vector.h */
00062 #define OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC 0xdb00110ad358eace
00063 
00064 /** Offset of magic number in the boot bus moveable region */
00065 #define OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC_OFFSET   0x70
00066 
00067 /** Offset within the boot bus moveable region for the boot vector table */
00068 #define OCTEON_BOOT_VECTOR_MOVEABLE_OFFSET  0x78
00069 
00070 /** Each per-node boot vector table also has a name */
00071 #define OCTEON_BOOT_VECTOR_LOCATOR_NAME "__cvmx_boot_vector_"
00072 
00073 #ifndef __ASSEMBLY__
00074 
00075 /*
00076  * This structure is access by bootloader, Linux kernel and the Linux
00077  * user space utility "bootoct".
00078 
00079  * In the bootloader, this structure is accessed by assembly code in start.S,
00080  * so any changes to content or size must be reflected there as well.
00081 
00082  * This is placed at a fixed address in DRAM, so that cores can access it
00083  * when they come out of reset.  It is used to setup the minimal bootloader
00084  * runtime environment (stack, but no heap, global data ptr) that is needed
00085  * by the non-boot cores to setup the environment for the applications.
00086  * The boot_info_addr is the address of a boot_info_block_t structure
00087  * which contains more core-specific information.
00088  *
00089  * The Linux kernel and the Linux bootoct utility access this structure for
00090  * implementing CPU hotplug functionality and booting of idle cores with SE
00091  * apps respectively.
00092  *
00093  */
00094 struct  boot_init_vector {
00095     /* First stage address - in ram instead of flash */
00096     uint64_t code_addr;
00097 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00098     /* Setup code for application, NOT application entry point */
00099     uint32_t app_start_func_addr;
00100     /* k0 is used for global data - needs to be passed to other cores */
00101     uint32_t k0_val;
00102 #else
00103     uint32_t k0_val;
00104     uint32_t app_start_func_addr;
00105 #endif  /* LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00106     /* Address of boot info block structure */
00107     uint64_t boot_info_addr;
00108 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00109     uint32_t flags;     /* flags */
00110     uint32_t pad;
00111 #else
00112     uint32_t pad;
00113     uint32_t flags;     /* flags */
00114 #endif  /* LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00115 };
00116 typedef struct  boot_init_vector boot_init_vector_t;
00117 
00118 #if defined(__ASM_GBL_DATA_H)   /* defined above */
00119 /*
00120  * Definition of a data structure to mimic the old u-boot gd_t data structure.
00121  */
00122 #undef GD_TMP_STR_SIZE
00123 #define GD_TMP_STR_SIZE 32
00124 
00125 /* This structure is deprecated, use sysinfo instead */
00126 struct linux_app_global_data {
00127 #if _MIPS_SZPTR == 32
00128     uint32_t pad0;
00129 #endif
00130     bd_t *bd;
00131     uint32_t flags;
00132     uint32_t baudrate;
00133     uint32_t have_console;  /* serial_init() was called */
00134     uint64_t ram_size;  /* RAM size */
00135     uint64_t reloc_off; /* Relocation Offset */
00136     uint32_t env_addr;  /* Address  of Environment struct */
00137     uint32_t env_valid; /* Checksum of Environment valid? */
00138     uint32_t cpu_clock_mhz; /* CPU clock speed in MHz */
00139     uint32_t ddr_clock_mhz; /* DDR clock (not data rate!) in MHz */
00140     uint32_t ddr_ref_hertz; /* DDR Ref clock Hertz */
00141     int mcu_rev_maj;
00142     int mcu_rev_min;
00143     int console_uart;
00144 
00145     /* EEPROM data structures as read from EEPROM or populated by other
00146      * means on boards without an EEPROM
00147      */
00148     octeon_eeprom_board_desc_t board_desc;
00149     octeon_eeprom_clock_desc_t clock_desc;
00150     octeon_eeprom_mac_addr_t mac_desc;
00151 
00152 #if _MIPS_SZPTR == 32
00153     uint32_t pad1;
00154 #endif
00155     void **jt;      /* jump table, not used */
00156 #if _MIPS_SZPTR == 32
00157     uint32_t pad2;
00158 #endif
00159     char *err_msg;      /* pointer to error message to save
00160                  * until console is up.  Not used.
00161                  */
00162     char tmp_str[GD_TMP_STR_SIZE];
00163 
00164     uint32_t uboot_flash_address;   /* Address of normal bootloader
00165                      * in flash
00166                      */
00167     uint32_t uboot_flash_size;  /* Size of normal bootloader */
00168     uint64_t dfm_ram_size;  /* DFM RAM size */
00169 };
00170 typedef struct linux_app_global_data linux_app_global_data_t;
00171 
00172 /* Flags for linux_app_global_data */
00173 #define LA_GD_FLG_RELOC         0x0001  /* Code was relocated to RAM     */
00174 #define LA_GD_FLG_DEVINIT       0x0002  /* Devices have been initialized */
00175 #define LA_GD_FLG_SILENT        0x0004  /* Silent mode                   */
00176 #define LA_GD_FLG_CLOCK_DESC_MISSING    0x0008
00177 #define LA_GD_FLG_BOARD_DESC_MISSING    0x0010
00178 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR_VERBOSE       0x0020
00179 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR0_CLK_INITIALIZED  0x0040
00180 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR1_CLK_INITIALIZED  0x0080
00181 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR2_CLK_INITIALIZED  0x0100
00182 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR3_CLK_INITIALIZED  0x0200
00183 #define LA_GD_FLG_FAILSAFE_MODE     0x0400  /* Use failsafe mode */
00184 #define LA_GD_FLG_DDR_TRACE_INIT    0x0800
00185 #define LA_GD_FLG_DFM_CLK_INITIALIZED   0x1000
00186 #define LA_GD_FLG_DFM_VERBOSE       0x2000
00187 #define LA_GD_FLG_DFM_TRACE_INIT    0x4000
00188 #define LA_GD_FLG_MEMORY_PRESERVED  0x8000
00189 #define LA_GD_FLG_RAM_RESIDENT      0x10000 /* RAM boot detected */
00190 #endif /* __ASM_GBL_DATA_H */
00191 
00192 /*
00193  * Definition of a data structure setup by the bootloader to enable Linux to
00194  * launch SE apps on idle cores.
00195  */
00196 struct linux_app_boot_info {
00197 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00198     uint32_t labi_signature;
00199     uint32_t start_core0_addr;
00200     uint32_t avail_coremask;
00201     uint32_t pci_console_active;
00202     uint32_t icache_prefetch_disable;
00203     uint32_t padding;
00204     uint64_t InitTLBStart_addr;
00205     uint32_t start_app_addr;
00206     uint32_t cur_exception_base;
00207     uint32_t no_mark_private_data;
00208     uint32_t compact_flash_common_base_addr;
00209     uint32_t compact_flash_attribute_base_addr;
00210     uint32_t led_display_base_addr;
00211 #else
00212     uint32_t start_core0_addr;
00213     uint32_t labi_signature;
00214 
00215     uint32_t pci_console_active;
00216     uint32_t avail_coremask;
00217 
00218     uint32_t padding;
00219     uint32_t icache_prefetch_disable;
00220 
00221     uint64_t InitTLBStart_addr;
00222 
00223     uint32_t cur_exception_base;
00224     uint32_t start_app_addr;
00225 
00226     uint32_t compact_flash_common_base_addr;
00227     uint32_t no_mark_private_data;
00228 
00229     uint32_t led_display_base_addr;
00230     uint32_t compact_flash_attribute_base_addr;
00231 #endif
00232 #if defined(__ASM_GBL_DATA_H)   /* defined above */
00233     linux_app_global_data_t gd;
00234 #endif
00235 };
00236 typedef struct linux_app_boot_info linux_app_boot_info_t;
00237 
00238 #endif

00240 /* If not to copy a lot of bootloader's structures
00241    here is only offset of requested member */
00242 #define AVAIL_COREMASK_OFFSET_IN_LINUX_APP_BOOT_BLOCK    0x765c
00243 
00244 /* hardcoded in bootloader */
00245 #define LABI_ADDR_IN_BOOTLOADER                         0x700
00246 
00247 #define LINUX_APP_BOOT_BLOCK_NAME "linux-app-boot"
00248 
00249 #define LABI_SIGNATURE 0xAABBCC01
00250 
00251 /*  from uboot-headers/octeon_mem_map.h */
00252 #if defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL) || defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_TOOLCHAIN)
00253 # define EXCEPTION_BASE_INCR     (4 * 1024)
00254 #endif
00255 
00256 /* Increment size for exception base addresses (4k minimum) */
00257 #define EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE     0
00258 
00259 #define BOOTLOADER_PRIV_DATA_BASE   (EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE + 0x800)
00260 /* 0x800 */
00261 #define BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR      (BOOTLOADER_PRIV_DATA_BASE)
00262 #define BOOT_VECTOR_NUM_WORDS       (8)
00263 #define BOOT_VECTOR_SIZE        ((CVMX_MAX_CORES * 4) * BOOT_VECTOR_NUM_WORDS)
00264 /* 0xe00 */
00265 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE      (BOOTLOADER_BOOT_VECTOR + BOOT_VECTOR_SIZE)    /* WORD */
00266 /* 0xe04 */
00267 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE_CORE (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE + 4)  /* WORD */
00268 
00269 /* ADDRESS 0xec4 */
00270 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_FLAGS_BASE     \
00271     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_TRAMPOLINE_CORE + 4*CVMX_MAX_CORES)
00272 
00273 /* 0xed0 */
00274 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_ALIGN_PAD     \
00275     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_FLAGS_BASE + 12)
00276 
00277 /* WORD address ED0 */
00278 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_RESET_COUNT   \
00279     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_ALIGN_PAD + 0)
00280 
00281 /* WORD address ED4 */
00282 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_REVID_COUNT   \
00283     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_RESET_COUNT + 4)
00284 
00285 /* WORD address ED8 */
00286 
00287 #define BOOTLOADER_NEXT_AVAIL_ADDR      \
00288     (BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_CORE_REVID_COUNT + 4)
00289 
00290 #define OCTEON_EXCEPTION_VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE  (CVMX_MAX_CORES*EXCEPTION_BASE_INCR)    /* 32 4k blocks */
00291 #define BOOTLOADER_DEBUG_REG_SAVE_BASE  (EXCEPTION_BASE_BASE + OCTEON_EXCEPTION_VECTOR_BLOCK_SIZE)
00292 
00293 #endif /* __OCTEON_BOOT_INFO_H__ */
